topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537810556368720e587e0000#post_537810556368720e587e0000
I was at Goodwill once. I go there when I get bored. I found a wooden homeade stoplight. With switches and everything. It didn't have a price tag on it anywhere so I asked a dude how much it was. He came by with a label gun. As soon as the $5 sticker landed on it I know that stoplight was going home with me.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537810f16368720bf9aa0000#post_537810f16368720bf9aa0000
I actually work for Goodwill, taking in donations. We get some pretty cool stuff, including a gigantic old timey radio. I wanted to take it home with me so bad...

You know you can build a really weird picture of people by the stuff they choose to donate.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537814906368720c72a80100#post_537814906368720c72a80100
I used to go a lot with my grandfather when I was a kid.
Hell I still go with him sometimes.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537810f16368720bf9aa0000#post_537810f16368720bf9aa0000
I'd like to say I went to Goodwill shopping for a PC, and a company upgrading their servers decided to donate a dual socket workstation with 2 Intel Xeon 2687W's with 128GB RAM each. The employee knew nothing at all about PC's and figured it was just some piece of junk and let me have it for 10 bucks.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53782c0e6368724e24290000#post_53782c0e6368724e24290000
It was a lot more than that.
Did you know that when the Twinkie was first invented it used banana cream instead of vanilla. They switched to vanilla due to war time rationing of bananas for soldiers.
